about.description:
zfp is an open source C/C++ library for compressed numerical arrays
that support high throughput read and write random access. zfp also
supports streaming compression of integer and floating-point data,
e.g., for applications that read and write large data sets to and
from disk. zfp is primarily written in C and C++ but also includes
Python and Fortran bindings.
about.summary: Library for compressed numerical arrays that support high throughput read and write random access

name: zfpy
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.20.2
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
    name: zfpy
    version: 0.5.5
source:
    patches:
        - 100-update-cmake.patch
    sha256: 6a7f4934489087d9c117a4af327fd6495ea757924f4df467b9c537abf8bd86c4
    url: https://github.com/LLNL/zfp/archive/0.5.5.tar.gz
build:
    number: 2
    script: source ${RECIPE_DIR}/build_zfpy.sh
    string: py36h8db7ee2_2
requirements:
    build:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
        - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
        - binutils_impl_linux-ppc64le 2.35 h9026189_9
        - binutils_linux-ppc64le 2.35 h844f0dc_28
        - bzip2 1.0.8 h6eb9509_3

        - gcc_linux-ppc64le 8.4.0 h1ce7429_28

        - libgomp 9.3.0 hdd5993f_15
        - libnghttp2 1.41.0 h0eba5ba_2
        - libssh2 1.9.0 h0e66b82_5
        - libstdcxx-devel_linux-ppc64le 8.4.0 h20c6264_16
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.3.0 h822a55f_15
        - libuv 1.40.0 h6eb9509_0

        - ncurses 6.2 hb209c28_1
        - openssl 1.1.1h h6eb9509_0
        - rhash 1.3.6 h14c3975_1001
        - sysroot_linux-ppc64le 2.17 h8b29623_10
        - tk 8.6.10 h151fe60_0
        - xz 5.2.5 h6eb9509_1
        - zlib 1.2.11 h6eb9509_1009
    host:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
        - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
        - ca-certificates 2020.6.20 hecda079_0
        - cython 0.29.21 py36hd724563_0
        - ld_impl_linux-ppc64le 2.35 h78afe3c_9
        - libblas 3.8.0 17_openblas
        - libcblas 3.8.0 17_openblas
        - libffi 3.2.1 hb209c28_1007
        - libgcc-ng 9.3.0 hdd5993f_15
        - libgfortran-ng 8.4.0 h822a55f_16
        - libgomp 9.3.0 hdd5993f_15
        - liblapack 3.8.0 17_openblas
        - libopenblas 0.3.10 pthreads_he532ed7_4
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.3.0 h822a55f_15
        - ncurses 6.2 hb209c28_1
        - numpy 1.16.5 py36hcee8f07_0
        - openssl 1.1.1h h6eb9509_0
        - python 3.6.11 h1e5e406_2_cpython
        - python_abi 3.6 1_cp36m
        - readline 8.0 h41a240f_2
        - sqlite 3.33.0 h433b40a_0
        - tk 8.6.10 h151fe60_0
        - xz 5.2.5 h6eb9509_1
        - zfp 0.5.5 hb209c28_2
        - zlib 1.2.11 h6eb9509_1009
    run:
        - libgcc-ng >=8.4.0
        - libstdcxx-ng >=8.4.0
        - numpy >=1.16.5,<2.0a0
        - python >=3.6,<3.7.0a0
        - python_abi 3.6.* *_cp36m
        - zfp 0.5.5 hb209c28_2
test:
    imports:
        - zfpy
about:
    description: 'zfp is an open source C/C++ library for compressed numerical arrays

        that support high throughput read and write random access. zfp also

        supports streaming compression of integer and floating-point data,

        e.g., for applications that read and write large data sets to and

        from disk. zfp is primarily written in C and C++ but also includes

        Python and Fortran bindings.

        '
    dev_url: https://github.com/LLNL/zfp
    doc_url: http://zfp.readthedocs.io/en/release0.5.5/
    home: https://computation.llnl.gov/projects/floating-point-compression
    license: BSD-3-Clause
    license_family: BSD
    license_file: LICENSE
    summary: Library for compressed numerical arrays that support high throughput
        read and write random access
extra:
    copy_test_source_files: true
    final: true
    recipe-maintainers:
        - GarrettDMorrison
        - ToreAad
        - hmaarrfk
        - kmpaul
        - lindstro
